name: places/ChIJFQhNBR_0wokRsDYW_X9xd08
formattedAddress: 286 Fort Washington Ave #1b, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 286 Fort Washington Ave #1b, New York, NY 10032, USA

originalText.text: I was seen on 11/27, right before my insurance was going to expire.  The receptionist wanted to squeeze an initial visit out of my insurance before it ran out. I scheduled a follow up appointment for 12/4 because I knew I was going to renew my insurance the only problem was that apparently it wasn't going to be activated until Jan 1st 2020. The office contacted me to basically tell me they couldn't see me anymore until my insurance started working. The receptionist also had a snarky attitude and followed it with a "how do you expect us to get paid?". I have worked in a medical office before and if they were aware that a patient had a pause in their insurance they would still see them because they understood that life happens and I am sure it was also just a smart business move. You give a little to get a little, especially with a sensitive issue like mental health. This office doesn't care they just want to take. Businesses like this is the reason behind why so many people in America suffer from mental health problems because they're in it for the money. They lack compassion or patience toward people who are suffering everyday with mental health issues but what goes around comes around and you will remember this comment.

originalText.text: If I could give 0 stars I would. My father has been under the care of this staff and has been waiting to have paperwork filled out  to verify him being treated by this office. The office has had the paperwork over 3 weeks and continues giving him the run around. Completely unprofessional, no one is on the same page when asking to speak to a supervisor or the doctor himself he is magically never there or with a patient and the "supervisor," because honestly this is just a puppet show orchestrated by a puppet master, is truly not any help either. Do NOT go here. Believe all the 1 star ratings. I rarely ever review, but this place has made a GREAT NEGATIVE impact giving this line of medicine a bad name. How could you work in the mental health field and make your patients worse and add on to the stressors? This is not the office to go to if you need help. Oh and by the way they charge YOU $10 for a letter that says your diagnosis or whatever you need on it, if you need one, yes for a piece of paper to verify your treatment!!! This isn't a doctor practice that follows the vow to help and save lives. If you need any kind of paperwork filled out you need to be there for 3 months or longer according to their "politics" and "you know because of one patient, the rest pay." Want a place full of excuses, this is it.

originalText.text: I went in to see Dr. Hernandez today. I left his office feeling worse than when I walked in. He spent most of his time typing. He showed no interest in what I was saying. He was just working off of a checklist. He was a cold as the stone walls that surround his office. I would not recommend Dr. Hernandez to my enemy. I question why someone would chose a public service profession, if you have zero interest in your patients needs. I am sorry that I picked this provider and am disappointed in the lack of service he provided.

originalText.text: I went to see him over a year ago. A clinic gave me his name and number and I was in need of help, desperately. I had to wait at least two hours to see him and I'm being generous. When I got there, the waiting room was full of patients and everyone had an appointment. I must've walked around the neighborhood like 5 times since I was so bored sitting there. It was pure torture. So then I finally get to see the man I've been waiting forever to see and talk about having no personality. This guy cannot be a doctor. He's very unprofessional! Sheesh. He took a phone call and was on the phone for about ten minutes, he was judgmental towards me based on personal things I told him, he made me feel like a big loser. I have always been honest with my doctors, especially a psychiatrist but with this guy, that was a YUGE mistake. He asked me if I had ever smoked weed and I said yes, ocassionally. After typing who knows what info his computer and not paying any attention to me whatsoever, he recommended that I go to rehab or pothead's anonymous. He said he wouldn't be taking me in until I cleaned up. I don't even know how to roll! When friends smoke, I may join but it's not something that I need or would even go buy. Not that there's anything wrong with smoking but I'm just not that into it. I tried to explain that to him but his hick, arrogant ass acted as if I wasn't even there after telling me that he wouldn't take me in. I really needed someone because I was very depressed and this guy just made me feel 100 times worse. I thought maybe it was me but from seeing the other reviews, I see that he's the problem. I didn't catch an attitude and I remained respectful even though I wanted to tell him off. Tears came down my face when I left his office. Something's just not right about him and I wish I knew what it is.

originalText.text: "Well versed in understanding and ability to explain medications to me, is an excellent psychiatrist.  He is knowledgeable about medications but also a skilled psychotherapist. Can't beat that combination. Highly recommend! provides compassionate and effective psychiatric services for those in need. Dr. Miguel Hernandez has a wonderful personality and comes across in a very calming fashion which puts his clients at ease immediately. Dr. Miguel Hernandez is extremely knowledgeable in all aspects of psychiatry, and many different treatment options. I would highly recommend Dr. Miguel Hernandez to anybody who needs compassionate and effective psychiatric services.
